aa.title: Assumption Audit
aa.description: Surface and rigorously test a field's hidden assumptions. Compound skill that chains extraction, inversion, research, ARAW testing, cross-domain perspective, and synthesis into a complete audit.

aar.title: aar
aar.description: The After Action Review (AAR) is a structured debrief to learn from experience.

aba.title: AI Biomedical Agent
aba.description: Procedure for using AI to analyze biomedical research, evaluate studies, assess drug interactions, and interpret clinical data.

ac.title: Adversarial Checklist
ac.description: Create a checklist that catches what normal checklists miss. Each item includes adversarial branches -- what if this assumption is wrong? Chains assumption extraction, failure anticipation, assumption inversion, and steps generation.
sections: What Makes This Different from Normal Checklists

acr.title: Active Recall
acr.description: Use retrieval practice and self-testing to strengthen learning and identify gaps

action.title: Execute a Command
action.description: Sub-orchestrator for commands and action requests. Routes to direct execution, step generation, or reclassifies when the command needs analysis first.

adep.title: Adaptive Extraction Pipeline
adep.description: Breadth-first, learned extraction pipeline that clarifies goals first, samples broadly, learns user preferences, and extracts selectively from highest-value items.

advr.title: advr
advr.description: Nothing is a fact until it survives an assassination attempt. Builder constructs claims, Breaker tries to destroy them.

ael.title: Assumption Elimination
ael.description: Before asserting anything, verify it can be confirmed by the listener.

aex.title: Assumption Extraction
aex.description: Extract hidden assumptions from any content. Surfaces what must be true for claims to hold, enabling deeper analysis.
sections: Example: "We should expand to the European market"

afa.title: afa
afa.description: A premortem imagines failure has already occurred, then works backward to identify what went wrong.

agi.title: ARAW to GOSM Integration
agi.description: Systematic procedure for translating ARAW exploration outputs

ai.title: Assumption Inversion
ai.description: Invert assumptions to discover blind spots and alternative possibilities. What if the opposite were true?
sections: Example: "We need to hire more engineers"

ais.title: Advocacy Infrastructure Setup
ais.description: Set up foundational infrastructure for autonomous advocacy operations

al.title: Active Listening
al.description: Systematic procedure for listening deeply to understand others, build trust, and improve communication outcomes

am.title: Academic Mastery
am.description: Master academic subjects through structured learning, concept mapping, and competency verification

ams.title: API Middleman Strategies
ams.description: Collection of strategies for bypassing or working around API limitations, including rate limits, IP blocks, and access restrictions.

analyze.title: Analyze a Situation
analyze.description: Sub-orchestrator for analytical requests. Routes to decomposition, systems analysis, comparison, risk assessment, or synthesis based on what kind of analysis is needed.

ans.title: Analogy Search (Cross-Domain Transfer)
ans.description: Many problems have been solved before - just in different domains.

ao.title: Algorithmic Optimization Orderings
ao.description: Orderings based on classic algorithm design paradigms: greedy, dynamic programming, divide-and-conquer, and branch-and-bound.

ap.title: Architecture Patterns
ap.description: Procedure for evaluating, choosing, and implementing software architecture patterns

ape.title: Alphacode Pass 1 Explicit
ape.description: First pass at competitive programming — explicit problem decomposition, constraint identification, and straightforward implementation.

api.title: Alphacode Pass 2 Implicit
api.description: Second pass at competitive programming — find implicit patterns, hidden structure, and optimizations the explicit pass missed.

apid.title: API Design
apid.description: Procedure for designing, implementing, and documenting effective APIs

apm.title: Alphacode Pass 3 Meta
apm.description: Third pass — meta-reasoning about solution correctness, confidence, and robustness. Catches what testing alone misses.

ar.title: Assume Right Search
ar.description: Assume Right - Deep recursive rightness search. For every claim, assume it's right — find what must follow, then assume THOSE implications are right too. Recurse until bedrock. Track every claim found.

araw.title: Assume Right / Assume Wrong Search
araw.description: Assume Right / Assume Wrong search - For every claim, explore what follows if true (AR) and what breaks if false (AW). Number every finding. Recurse until bedrock. Compile a complete registry. Derive synthesis only from the registry.

arcd.title: Architecture Design Orderings
arcd.description: Orderings for software development — outside-in vs inside-out, API-first vs domain-first, top-down vs bottom-up.

argd.title: Argumentative Document
argd.description: Construct a rigorous argumentative document with thesis, evidence, counterarguments, and structured reasoning.

asu.title: Assumption Surfacing
asu.description: Plans and beliefs rest on assumptions that are often invisible.

atgb.title: ARAW to GOSM Bridge
atgb.description: Bridges ARAW exploration outputs to GOSM planning inputs.

auep.title: Automated Extraction Pipeline
auep.description: Industrial-scale automation pipeline for extracting procedures from 70+ YouTube channels and other sources using the Ralph Wiggum / Conductor pattern for iterative LLM-driven extraction.

av.title: Assumption Verification
av.description: Systematically verify assumptions by classifying type, determining verification method, executing, and updating confidence.

aw.title: Assume Wrong Search
aw.description: Assume Wrong - Deep recursive wrongness search. For every claim, assume it's wrong — find why, then assume THOSE reasons are wrong too. Recurse until bedrock. Track every claim found.

b.title: Budgeting
b.description: Create, manage, and optimize budgets for projects, organizations, or personal finances

be.title: Bandit Exploration Orderings
be.description: Orderings from multi-armed bandit algorithms for balancing exploration of unknown options with exploitation of known good ones.

bes.description: Like playing 20 Questions - each yes/no question eliminates half the possibilities. For N options, at most log2(N) questions needed.

bi.description: Unbounded inquiry cannot terminate - every answer opens new questions.

pcef.title: pcef
pcef.description: Unified framework for procedure effectiveness tracking — operational and empirical.

pcex.title: Extract and Generalize Procedures
pcex.description: After completing a goal, extract reusable procedures and generalize them for storage in the library, enabling GOSM to learn from completed work.

pci.title: Procedure Improvement
pci.description: Systematically improve GOSM library procedures using schema-driven validation and tier-based progress tracking

pefs.title: Procedure Extraction from Source
pefs.description: Meta-procedure for extracting implicit procedures from ANY external source, turning tacit knowledge into explicit, reusable GOSM-compatible procedures.

pf.title: Priority Framework Orderings
pf.description: Classic priority frameworks — Eisenhower matrix, MoSCoW, RICE, weighted scoring — for systematic ranking.

pge.title: Pedagogy/Educational Orderings
pge.description: Orderings from learning science — interleaving, spacing, testing effect, desirable difficulties — for durable understanding.

ph.title: ph
ph.description: Not all procedures are equal. There is a hierarchy of meta-procedures and content procedures.

pha.title: Phone Acquisition
pha.description: Acquire and configure phone numbers for autonomous system operations

pjc.title: Project Closure
pjc.description: Complete projects properly with handoff and learning capture

pji.title: Project Initiation
pji.description: Launch projects with clear charter, stakeholders, and success criteria

pjm.title: Project Management Orderings
pjm.description: Orderings from formal project management — PERT, CPM, Critical Chain, Agile — for scheduling and resource management.

pjs.title: Project Scoping
pjs.description: Define project scope — what's included, excluded, success criteria, constraints, and boundaries. Prevents scope creep.

plr.title: Policy Research
plr.description: Identify evidence-based, neglected, tractable policies for advocacy campaigns

po.title: Personal Optimization
po.description: N-of-1 experimentation framework for systematically improving personal health,

poa.title: Possibility Analysis
poa.description: Systematically explore the possibility space of what could be done.

pos.title: Positioning Strategy
pos.description: Develop clear market positioning through category design, differentiation, and compelling messaging

pp.title: Procurement Procedures
pp.description: Managing procurement of components and materials — sourcing, ordering, tracking, receiving, and verification.

pqr.title: pqr
pqr.description: A 24-week rotating list of questions for weekly review.

prd.title: Presentation Design
prd.description: Systematic procedure for designing visually effective presentations, slides, and handouts that enhance rather than compete with your message

pre.title: Preference Elicitation
pre.description: Elicit user preferences by presenting concrete trade-offs rather than asking open-ended questions. System does the work by generating options and letting user select.
sections: Step 3: Present as Scenarios, Not Abstractions

prm.title: Pre-Mortem Analysis
prm.description: Gary Klein's technique - assume it went wrong and ask why. People are better at explaining past events than predicting future ones.

prr.title: Procedure Registry Review
prr.description: Review and improve the procedure registry schema using explicit definitions, evidence alignment, and non-regression.

pss.title: Plan Space Search
pss.description: There are always multiple ways to achieve a goal.

pt.title: Progress Tracking
pt.description: Monitor and report project status effectively

pus.title: Public Speaking
pus.description: Systematic procedure for preparing and delivering impactful presentations, speeches, and talks

pv.title: Procedure Validation
pv.description: Validate that a procedure is complete, executable, and all dependencies are satisfiable. Catches issues before execution.

pvg.title: pvg
pvg.description: Handler for goals focused on PREVENTING bad outcomes rather than achieving good ones.

pw.title: Persuasive Writing
pw.description: Systematic procedure for writing persuasive content that influences readers and motivates action

pwc.title: Pairwise Comparison Matrix
pwc.description: Instead of rating each option absolutely (hard), compare pairs

qaf.title: Question Analysis Framework
qaf.description: This framework provides methods for analyzing questions to determine:

qag.title: Question About Guesses
qag.description: Generate high-quality questions about identified guesses. Applies quality criteria and "why continue?" gate to prevent low-value questioning.

qg.title: qg
qg.description: When you don't know something, the right question is worth more than hours of speculation.

qm.title: qm
qm.description: Procedure for measuring outcomes that resist quantification.

qo.title: Question Ordering
qo.description: Find the satisfying unresolved question that opens a document and order all questions in a dependency chain. Upstream of /w.

qr.title: Qualitative Research
qr.description: Systematic procedure for qualitative data analysis including coding, thematic analysis, grounded theory, and interview techniques

qs.title: Queue Scheduling Orderings
qs.description: Orderings for managing queues — FIFO, priority queues, shortest job first, fair queuing.

rc5w.title: Root Cause Analysis - Adaptive Why Chain
rc5w.description: Adaptive root cause analysis. Ask "why" until you hit the root. Sometimes that's 2 levels, sometimes 12. Stop when you find the cause, not at a fixed number.

rca.title: Root Cause Analysis
rca.description: Systematically trace symptoms back to their underlying root causes using structured diagnostic techniques. Supports context-adaptive variants.
sections: Step 0: Context Detection and Variant Selection

rci.title: Recursive Causal Interrogation
rci.description: A systematic approach to reasoning: tracing causes through questioning.

re.title: Reading Effectively
re.description: Read strategically for comprehension, retention, and application using research-backed techniques

ret.title: Retrospective
ret.description: Learn from completed work to improve future performance

rf.title: Refactoring
rf.description: Procedure for systematically improving code structure without changing behavior

ria.title: Risk Assessment
ria.description: Systematic procedure for identifying, analyzing, and planning responses to risks

rlg.title: Relationship Goals
rlg.description: Handle relationship-related goals — clarify desired state, assess current reality, identify gaps, plan actions within your control.

rm.title: Risk Management Orderings
rm.description: Orderings for managing uncertainty — preserve options, handle irreversible decisions carefully, minimize downside.

rmo.title: Resume Optimization
rmo.description: Systematic approach to crafting resumes that pass ATS filters, capture attention,

roa.title: ROI Analysis
roa.description: Calculate and analyze return on investment for projects, purchases, and decisions

rqg.title: Requirements Gathering
rqg.description: Elicit and document system requirements from stakeholders

rsg.title: rsg
rsg.description: Handler for goals focused on REBUILDING from damage, not improving from baseline.

rso.title: Resource Optimization Orderings
rso.description: Orderings for maximizing throughput, minimizing waste, and efficient resource utilization.

rva.title: Reversibility Analysis
rva.description: Systematic procedure for analyzing decision reversibility, option value, and optimal commitment timing

saaapcav.title: Apply Analysis Protocol Clarity + Validity
saaapcav.description: Use the analysis-protocol clarity question bank to audit a gate/procedure/document for interpretability, checkability, and stopping rules.

saadag.title: saadag
saadag.description: Run the detector suite against a target artifact to find ambiguity, proxy substitution, bundled checks, and more.

saaesa.title: Apply Evidence Standard Application
saaesa.description: Audit a document as if it claimed an evidence standard, and require checkable verification (or pointers to verification) for any “verified” claims.

saaiasa.title: saaiasa
saaiasa.description: Classify utterances in a gate/procedure/document so the system doesn't answer the wrong thing.

sacri.title: sacri
sacri.description: Ensure gates and procedures link to other procedures that provide the needed answer-interface and next steps.

sadrt.title: sadrt
sadrt.description: Estimate where two independent executors would diverge when applying the same gate/procedure to the same input.

sads.title: Detector Sweep
sads.description: Scan files for ambiguity, proxying, bundled questions, undefined terms, hidden conditionals, goal substitution, and conventional bias.

sagsca.title: Gate Schema Consistency Audit
sagsca.description: Identify inconsistent gate field schemas across the library that increase interpretation burden and cause engine integration drift.

sapea.title: sapea
sapea.description: Check whether a procedure's questions/steps can be executed without interpretation and whether outputs are checkable.

saqrc.title: saqrc
saqrc.description: Rewrite unclear questions by separating intent from target question.

saropc.title: saropc
saropc.description: Apply Recursive Causal Interrogation to choices about what procedure to run, what to measure, and when to stop.

sarus.title: sarus
sarus.description: Repo-wide scan to find question patterns that commonly require interpretation before answering.

satrda.title: Two-Run Divergence Audit
satrda.description: Run the same gate/procedure twice on the same fixed input, compare outputs, and treat divergences as evidence that the text needs clearer interfaces and stopping rules.

sbfow.title: Still Bad, Figure Out Why
sbfow.description: Still Bad, Figure Out Why - Self-diagnosis when output was rejected. Systematically test which criteria the output failed against, find the root pattern, and derive what must change.

sdp.title: Embedded Software Development
sdp.description: Developing embedded software for robotics and microcontroller-based systems.

se.title: Space Enumeration
se.description: Generate comprehensive lists by systematically covering all dimensions. Ensures nothing is missed through structured enumeration.

search.title: Explore a Space
search.description: Sub-orchestrator for exploration. Routes to UAUA, space enumeration, or dimension discovery based on what's known and what's needed.

seb.title: SEO Fundamentals
seb.description: Build organic search visibility through keyword research, on-page optimization, content strategy, and link building

sel.title: Selection
sel.description: Make the final selection from ranked options after all analysis is complete. Includes LLM-compatible feasibility assessment.
sections: Step 6: Define Success Criteria and Reversal Triggers

sep.title: Security Practices
sep.description: Procedure for implementing security throughout the software development lifecycle

sf.title: Save File
sf.description: Save the output from the most recent skill invocation to the appropriate library folder. Only saves when explicitly requested.

shc.title: System Health Check
shc.description: Evaluate if the GOSM system needs improvement

ska.title: Skill Acquisition
ska.description: Systematically acquire new skills using deliberate practice principles

skb.title: Skill Benchmarking
skb.description: Identify quality standards, benchmark current skill level, and design deliberate practice to close gaps

skm.title: Stakeholder Management
skm.description: Engage stakeholders effectively throughout the project

skp.title: Skill Plateaus
skp.description: Diagnose the causes of skill plateaus and implement targeted strategies to break through

smc.title: smc
smc.description: An exhaustive inventory of search methods found in nature, science, technology, and human systems.

sms.title: Social Media Strategy
sms.description: Build effective social media presence through platform selection, content planning, engagement, and measurement

sn.title: Salary Negotiation
sn.description: Systematic approach to negotiating job offers that maximizes total compensation

snp.title: snp
snp.description: The future is uncertain. Develop multiple plausible futures and prepare strategies that work across them.

so.title: so
so.description: Standardized output format for GOSM projects.

sop.title: Source Prioritization
sop.description: Given limited time to extract procedures from sources, prioritize which sources to process for maximum procedure value.

sor.title: Source Research
sor.description: Systematic procedure for finding, evaluating, and synthesizing information from primary and secondary sources.

sp.title: Steelman Prompt
sp.description: Improves a prompt before it gets answered. Adds precision, scope, criteria, and failure-proofing without answering the question.

spd.title: Space Discovery
spd.description: Discover what space exists BEFORE generating guesses. Maps dimensions, stakeholders, time horizons, and adjacent spaces. Run this before guess_generation to ensure comprehensive coverage.
sections: Step 1: What COULD This Be About?
Step 2: Who COULD Care About This?
Step 3: What Time Frames COULD Matter?
Step 5: What Adjacent Spaces COULD Connect?
Step 6: What Types of Claims COULD Exist?

spe.title: spe
spe.description: Extends the search paradigm to non-obvious domains. Identifies which search methods should become procedures.

spg.title: Specificity Gate
spg.description: Transform vague capability claims into specific ones by requiring trigger, procedure, output, and validation for each claim.
sections: Step 4: Generate Questions for Missing Elements

spp.title: Spatial Proteomics
spp.description: Procedure for designing and analyzing spatial proteomics experiments to map protein localization and interactions in tissue context.

spr.title: Spaced Repetition
spr.description: Design and implement spaced repetition systems for durable long-term retention of knowledge

src.title: Source Credibility Assessment
src.description: Procedure for evaluating the credibility and reliability of any information source

srd.title: Strategic Competitive Orderings
srd.description: Orderings for competitive contexts — influence perception, manage attention, create strategic advantage through sequencing.

ssr.title: Session Review (Learning Capture)
ssr.description: Capture learnings at end of session for continuous improvement. Reviews what worked, what did not, surprises, and procedure gaps.

st.title: st
st.description: Every strategy exists within a game. Characterize the game, design strategies with clear mechanisms, evaluate along key dimensions.

sta.title: Statistical Analysis
sta.description: Systematic procedure for selecting appropriate statistical tests and correctly interpreting results

stc.title: Steelmanned Counterarguments
stc.description: Generate the strongest possible counterarguments to a position, then assess which ones genuinely threaten it.

std.title: Strategy Discovery
std.description: Find or create an approach to achieve a goal

stg.title: Steps Generation
stg.description: Transform a COMPLETE_PLAN into foolproof executable step-by-step instructions

stl.title: Storytelling
stl.description: Systematic procedure for crafting and delivering compelling stories that create emotional connection and drive action

svs.title: Systematic Variation (SCAMPER)
svs.description: SCAMPER is an acronym for 7 transformation operations:

swa.title: SWOT Analysis
swa.description: Systematically identify Strengths, Weaknesses, Opportunities, and Threats to inform strategic decisions

sya.title: Systems Analysis
sya.description: Analyze complex systems using causal loop diagrams, stock and flow models, feedback loop identification, and system archetypes

sym.title: sym
sym.description: Real problems exist in complex systems with many interacting parts. Comprehensive system modeling ontology.

t.title: Targeting
t.description: Build comprehensive database of advocacy targets with personalized dossiers

td.title: Temporal/Deadline Orderings
td.description: Orderings driven by temporal constraints, deadlines, and timing requirements.

technical.title: Domain-Specific Routing
technical.description: Sub-orchestrator for domain-specific questions. Routes to specialized skills based on domain and task type.

tnt.title: tnt
tnt.description: Specific, tested tactics for navigating the most common value tensions and conflicts.

to.title: Topological Ordering
to.description: Generate valid execution sequences from dependencies. Respects hard constraints, optimizes for priorities, and identifies parallel execution opportunities.

tp.title: tp
tp.description: Arguments form dependency graphs. When any assumption's truth value changes, propagate through all dependent conclusions.

tpm.title: Template Maintenance
tpm.description: Maintain and improve domain templates over time. Track usage, identify gaps, and evolve templates based on experience.

tr.title: Template Registry
tr.description: Registry for domain templates. Store, retrieve, search, and manage domain-specific configurations.

ts.title: Testing Strategy
ts.description: Procedure for designing and implementing effective software testing strategies

txm.title: Taxonomy Maintenance
txm.description: Systematic process for creating, updating, and maintaining taxonomies and classification systems.

u.title: Universalize
u.description: Universalize - Extract the complete space of assumptions, dimensions, and alternatives from any claim. Map before you judge. Track every finding.

uaua.title: Universalize -> ARAW -> Universalize -> ARAW
uaua.description: UAUA Combined Exploration - Universalize, ARAW, loop, synthesize. Map possibilities with numbered findings, test rigorously with numbered claims, compile a complete registry, derive synthesis only from the registry.

uga.title: Universal Goal Analysis Framework
uga.description: The comprehensive question framework that applies to EVERY goal, regardless of domain. Universal analysis procedure.
sections: Decision Tree: When to Go Deeper

ugav2.title: ugav2
ugav2.description: The comprehensive question framework v2 — actionable questions with fact-yielding answers.

ugav3.title: ugav3
ugav3.description: The comprehensive question framework v3 — fully decomposed, no interpretation variance.

ugav4.title: ugav4
ugav4.description: The comprehensive question framework that applies to EVERY goal, regardless of domain. Version 4.0.

ugav5.title: ugav5
ugav5.description: The comprehensive question framework v5 — adds operational, meta-cognitive, and quality categories.

unx.title: Unexpected - Non-Obvious Solution Discovery
unx.description: Find non-obvious solutions. Three layers — obvious, unexpected, reframed — using disruption techniques that force the search off its default path.

uo.title: uo
uo.description: Every output must be unassailable. Nothing wrong with form, content, length, logic, precision, completeness, or necessity.

va.title: va
va.description: For any obvious strategy, ask what if we did the exact opposite. Counters the tendency to accept first-good-enough answers.

val.title: Validation
val.description: Verify that an output meets its requirements

vbo.title: Verification Before Output
vbo.description: This procedure is the culmination of the no-guessing philosophy.
sections: Step 7: Specificity Check for Capability Claims

vcd.title: Value Conflict Decomposition
vcd.description: Goals often serve multiple intrinsic values that conflict with each other.

vdp.title: Visual Design Principles
vdp.description: Eight principles of visual design derived from first principles (cognitive load, gestalt perception, reading research). Use as a gate before any visual design work -- every design decision should trace back to one of these principles. If a design element can't be justified by a principle, remove it.
sections: What This Skill Does NOT Cover

ve.title: Value Elicitation
ve.description: Value elicitation discovers what someone ACTUALLY values - their intrinsic goals.

ver.title: GOSM Verification Procedure
ver.description: Verify claims using the GOSM verification standard. Every claim must be OBSERVED, TESTED, or DERIVED - never guessed.

vhd.title: vhd
vhd.description: Framework for deciding when to improve existing procedures (vertical) versus add new ones (horizontal).

viability.title: Test an Idea
viability.description: Sub-orchestrator for ideas and proposals. Routes to ARAW viability testing with appropriate development and risk assessment.

vm.title: Viral Mechanics
vm.description: Design and optimize viral loops, referral programs, and word-of-mouth triggers to achieve organic growth

vp.title: Verification and Testing Procedures
vp.description: Systematic testing and verification that systems meet requirements.

w.title: High Quality Writing
w.description: Generative writing tool. Criteria-based specification for satisfying prose. Organized hierarchically — upstream criteria determine whether writing works; downstream criteria determine how well.

want.title: Clarify a Goal
want.description: Sub-orchestrator for goals and wants. Routes to WantTo analysis to trace what the want commits you to and find the actual want.

wr.title: Weekly Review
wr.description: Weekly review procedure to maintain visibility across all active projects, identify stalled work, and ensure continuous progress.

wt.title: WANTTO - I Want To
wt.description: Want To - AR-based goal exploration. Assume the want is right, trace what it commits you to, find what you actually want, map paths forward.
